awd_titl_txt: REU Site: Snapshots of Chemistry -- Visualization of Processes at the Molecular Level
awd_abstract_narration:
This Research Experiences for Undergraduates (REU) Site at the University of Southern California is located in Los Angeles, CA. The site supports the training of 10 students over 10 weeks during the summers of 2018-2021. Professor Kyung Jung leads this site which is supported by the Division of Chemistry in the Mathematical and Physical Science Directorate. The site offers original research projects on a wide array of chemistry related topics. Student participants are paired with one of 32 research-active faculty members to pursue unique projects, collect and analyze data, and organize results for reports and presentations. Prior to the start of the program, students participate in a newly designed, preparative pre-summer REU program. Students develop skills necessary for professional chemistry careers by engaging in long-term mentoring relationships and taking part in faculty-led seminars and discussions on topics like responsible conduct in research, choosing a graduate school, and careers in chemistry. Students also build a cohesive community of peers, mentors, and graduate student advisors through participation in social activities. This program is committed to expanding access to research experiences among underserved and minority students from Southern California community colleges and primarily undergraduate institutions, first-generation college students, veterans, and people with disabilities. The program helps students become role models for their peers and attract other students to science programs. This synergy contributes to human resource development by improving the national pipeline into advanced education and career success in STEM fields.  

This REU program provides students with intensive hands-on experience in a wide array of chemistry sub-disciplines, including organic synthesis, reaction catalysis, mechanistic chemistry, biochemistry and biophysics, materials chemistry, theoretical chemistry and reaction dynamics, and ultra-fast spectroscopy. Examples of projects include the conversion of solar energy in chemical bonds, molecular synthesis, and visualizing molecular interactions between drugs and biological targets. Each participant conducts independent research in a participating faculty group and is trained closely by a faculty advisor and assisted by a graduate student mentor. This model empowers students to conduct individual research projects in their choice of research area. Students are encouraged to disseminate their work through publication in peer-reviewed journals or presentations at scientific conferences. To ensure a quality program, this site is evaluated annually in collaboration with the USC STEM Education Research Group and is refined accordingly.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SITE-Res Exp for Ugrd Site

por.por_cntn:
The REU program at the University of Southern California (USC) provided an intensive hands-on experience in a wide array of chemistry sub-disciplines, ranging from the conversion of solar energy in chemical bonds to molecular synthesis and biochemical study for visualizing molecular interactions between drugs and biological targets. Each student conducted independent research in a participating faculty group aligned with their interests and was trained closely by a faculty advisor who was assisted by a graduate student mentor. In addition to individual research, REU students participated in a series of career development seminars (e.g., Responsible Conducts of Research, Careers in Academics, and Industries), instrument training sessions, and toured local museums and research facilities in the Los Angeles area. REU students presented their work via poster presentations to the entire department at the end of the program.

The REU program had a profound impact on the career paths of our participants by providing long-term mentorship and support toward pursuing careers in STEM-related fields. During the 2018-2023 funding period, our site hosted 42 participants, with 64% of them being members of underrepresented groups. Of the 42 participants, 27 have completed their undergraduate degrees in Chemistry or other STEM majors while the other 15 are currently completing their college studies as juniors and seniors. Of the 27 students who have graduated, 16 have proceeded to PhD/MS programs in Chemistry while 7 obtained jobs in STEM industries. During this funding period, REU participants have co-authored 14 peer-reviewed papers and 13 students have received 25 award recognitions (e.g., ACS awards, AIC awards, Barry Goldwater Scholarships, NSF Graduate Research Fellowships, etc.). A unique feature of our program is the pre-summer REU activities, which provide local community college students with hands-on experience preparing them for a professional career in research. During 2018-2023, our program trained 10 pre-summer REU participants, including two students who later enrolled in the Chemistry PhD program at USC.

An independent assessment conducted at the end of our 2023 program revealed that participants had very positive reviews of our program overall. The REU program strengthened the participant’s interest in chemistry and their long-term goal of obtaining a degree in Chemistry or chemistry-related fields.  Most participants agreed that their increased interest in chemistry was because of their experience in our REU program.  The program was very effective in achieving the stated learning outcomes, namely enhancing student exposure to chemistry research, methods, concepts, theories, and ethics. The survey also suggested that the program could provide better instructions for peripheral skills, such as oral, visual, and written communication.

In summary, the USC REU site successfully hosted a diverse group of students in the summer and pre-summer REU programs. Participants gained invaluable experience in chemical research, which in turn inspired them to pursue further education in chemistry and/or related fields. These students have proceeded or will proceed to advanced education programs. They will serve as role models during the recruitment of future participants to our program. We are very proud of our former REU participants who will become significant assets to the fields of STEM research and education.


Last Modified: 11/28/2023
Modified by: Kyung W Jung
